incidents.name: Conversations Service Returning 5xxs

incident_updates.body:
A set of Twilio services (Twilio Conversations, Sync, Verify and Flex) were degraded for 1 minute between 05:07 and 05:08 Pacific Time. During this period of time customers may have experienced and elevated number of 5xx errors and latency on the API endpoints. Additionally, SDKs might have had issues connecting to Twilio websocket infrastructure. 

It is possible that due to degradation of the Twilio Conversations services, Default Conversation Service can be incorrect for some customers. If this is the case, please update the Default Service in Twilio Console under Conversations and report the issue to Twilio Support for Tracking Purposes. The issue has now been resolved.

A set of Twilio services (Twilio Conversations, Sync, Verify and Flex) were degraded for 1 minute between 05:07 and 05:08 Pacific Time. During this period of time customers may have experienced and elevated number of 5xx errors and latency on the API endpoints. Additionally, SDKs might have had issues connecting to Twilio websocket infrastructure. 

It is possible that due to degradation of the Twilio Conversations services, Default Conversation Service can be incorrect for some customers. If this is the case, please update the Default Service in Twilio Console under Conversations and report the issue to Twilio Support for Tracking Purposes. The issue has now been resolved.
Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with Conversations. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

incidents.name: Billing Issues With Subset of IoT Customers

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have deployed a fix, and the service has recovered fully. This incident has been resolved.

Since midnight UTC today, IoT usage from May 28 through May 31st has been incorrectly counted twice when calculating your Twilio account balance. This would have caused your account balance to appear lower than it should and may have led to your credit card being charged to bring your account balance back up to amount set in your auto recharge settings. Our engineering team is currently working on stopping the double counting of the usage so your balance will be correctly reflected, including any additional funds that may have been added to your account from your auto recharge being triggered.

We expect to provide another update in 4 hours, or as soon as we have more information.

Since midnight UTC today, IoT usage from May 28 through May 31st has been incorrectly counted twice when calculating your Twilio account balance. Our engineering team is currently working on stopping the double counting of the usage so your balance will be correctly reflected, including any additional funds that may have been added to your account from your auto recharge being triggered.

We expect to provide another update in 2 hours, or as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Conversations Service Returning 404s

incident_updates.body: Default Conversation Service is operational now. If you are still seeing 404s, please update the Default Service in Twilio Console under Conversations.

Our engineers have identified the issue causing Default Conversations service returning 404s for some customers when fetching or updating a Conversation, and the issue has been mitigated. If you have noticed that your Default Conversation Service was not correct, please update the Default Service in Twilio Console under Conversations and report the issue to Twilio Support for Tracking Purposes. incidents.name: Live Logging Issues

incident_updates.body: Live logging was degraded for 2 hours and 47 minutes between 06:01 and 08:48 Pacific Time on 06/01/2023. incidents.name: MMS Delivery Delays to AT&T in the US From a Subset of Shortcodes and Toll Free Numbers

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing MMS delivery delays when sending messages to AT&T in the US from a subset of shortcodes and toll free numbers.  This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to Meteor Network in Ireland

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Meteor network in Ireland. This incident has been resolved.

We are observing recovery in SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Meteor network in Ireland. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to experience SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Meteor network in Ireland. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to experience SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Meteor network in Ireland. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are again experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Meteor network in Ireland. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on ~7.7% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: We will close the post on Twilio’s Status Page. If you have been impacted by this incident and wish to continue to receive updates, please open a ticket with customer support.

We are now seeing recovery of the previously reported connectivity issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues where we're observing ~7.7% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 6:32PM UTC, we observed ~7.7% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
